result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton D. Rodaks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further argumentative or confrontational contact with V. Chipman and/or J. Drover.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   ID process completed with the Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton D. Rodaks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned by USPS - No Mail Receptacle - Unable to Forward

ADDRESS INFO for Colton D. Rodaks
Current: 376 Broadway St, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2016)
Prior: PO Box 586, c/o Green Lake Co Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States

Case Called @ 11:03 AM: Defendant Colton D. Rodaks in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.  DA argues for $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection to bond request of the State.  The Court:  Orders $1000 Signature Bond as requested.  Following the order for Bond, Atty Selsing requests P/S Scheduled.  Counsel agree to proceed today to P/S.  Off Record to confirm agreement and Victim Rights Compliance.  Back of Record at 11:15 AM:  Joint recommendation recited by DA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. State confirms Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea w/o Repeater Enh:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Outright Dismissal of Repeater component attached to the charge.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  60 days WCJ - I/S - S/W - 1 yr probation:  Conditions:  Completion of AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate; No argumentative or confrontational contact with V. Chipman and/or J. Drover; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Must Complete ID; DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is currently incarcerated in the Green Lake Co Jail with no certain date of release. The Court will again adjourn the IA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Colton D. Rodaks

Prior: N1199 County Road Nz, Neshkoro, WI 54960

Defendant Colton D. Rodaks not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court was made aware of a message rec'd from DOC Agent to COC that Def was being held in the Green Lake Co Jail.  In light of incarceration, Court adjourns IA until after 2/10/2016 to avoid a writ for transport.  AIA adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
